title: Prelert to Share Advice on Applying Anomaly Detection to Fight Bank Card Fraud at .conf2015: Splunk’s Worldwide Users’ Conference
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/16/2015 @ 6:39 AM   Prelert 
FRAMINGHAM, Mass. & LAS VEGAS -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Prelert , the leading provider of behavioral analytics for IT security and operations teams, today announced details of its participation at .conf2015 : The Sixth Annual Splunk Worldwide Users’ Conference, taking place from September 21-24, 2015 at the MGM Grand inLas Vegas, Nevada. 
Prelert will be exhibiting as a Giga Sponsor in the Partner Pavilion and available throughout the conference to meet with those interested in learning its capabilities. Prelert leverages machine learning anomaly detection to uncover advanced cyber threats, IT performance problems and fraud, helping organizations quickly detect and mitigate incidents. By combining the power of Splunk® solutions with Prelert, companies get instant insight to significant outlier behaviors that could indicate a security threat or performance problem – and are empowered to instantly determine the best response. 
Andrew Linn and Christopher Thompson of Orrstown Bank , an East Coast-based community bank with more than $1.2 billion in assets, will be presenting on how Prelert’s behavioral analytics can be used to identify and ultimately prevent bank card fraud. The presentation will show how Orrstown is using Prelert and Splunk Cloud to tackle a growing volume of credit and debit card fraud. Attendees will learn how Splunk Cloud and Prelert’s Anomaly Detective have been used to identify fraudulent card transactions in a manner that’s cheaper and more flexible than traditional fraud detection solutions. The session will take place on September 22, 2015 at 5:00 P.M. 
.conf2015 is Splunk’s largest educational and training event of the year, attracting 4,000+ IT pros in security, applications development and management, operations, cloud, SaaS, business, web analytics and more. Register for the show here and follow the conversation during the conference on Twitter with the hashtag #splunkconf . 
About Prelert Prelert is the leading provider of behavioral analytics for IT security and operations teams. The company’s solution analyzes an organization’s log data, finds anomalies, links them together and lets the data tell the story behind advanced cyber threats and IT performance problems. Leveraging machine learning anomaly detection and other behavioral analytics capabilities, the solution automates the analysis of massive data sets, eliminating manual effort and human error. Hundreds of progressive IT organizations rely on Prelert to detect advanced threat activity, reduce false positive alerts and enable faster root cause analysis. Prelert lets your data tell the story.
